example[0]: Luke’s behaviour caused his parents great distress.
example[1]: The girl was crying and clearly in distress.
definition[1]: suffering and problems caused by a lack of money, food etc
example[3]: charities that aid families in distress
definition[3]: a situation when a ship, aircraft etc is in danger and needs help
example[4]: We picked up a distress signal 6 km away.
definition[4]: to make someone feel very upset
example[6]: The dream had distressed her greatly.
definition[5]: when someone’s goods are taken with the permission of a court of law so that they can be sold to pay unpaid rent, bills etc
example[7]: The corporation had a power of absolute and immediate distress in the event of non-payment of dues.
